result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Anthony Potack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • OWI (1st). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ryan Anthony Potack in court with attorney Arne Richard Skatrud.  Defendant Ryan Anthony Potack in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14 CF 179 and 14 CF 44.  State argues sentencing - counts 2,3,4 and 5 in 14 CF 44 - 1 year jail - any unpaid court obligations to be converted to civil judgment and 14 CF 179 count 2 - 90 days consecutive to 14 CF 44 - any unpaid court obligations converted to civil judgment.  Atty Skatrud argues sentencing.  DE addressed the Court


COURT:  14 CF 44:  1 year county jail with credit for 264 days time served with good time and huber (each case concurrent with each other) count 5 is 9 months county jail -  any unpaid court obligations to be converted to civil judgment
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 23, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Ryan Anthony Potack in court with attorney Arne Richard Skatrud.  Defendant Ryan Anthony Potack in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  14 CF 179.  State addressed the Court finds errors.  Atty Skatrud makes stmt requests to go forward today.  Court makes stmt.  Victim Rights not complied with at this time - court will adjourn these matters.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for March 23, 2018 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt: 60 days conditional jail time, starting 5/19/2017.  Huber is authorized.

Defendant Ryan Anthony Potack in court, in custody.    Probation agent Katie Garrett appeared.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Bruce Poquette addressed the Court.  Ms. Garrett addressed the Court probation was to be completed on 10/21/17 but had obsconded - DE has not complied with his conditions of probation.  Ms. Garrett states he is currently on a probation hold.  requests 60 days conditional jail.  Court addressed the DE.  DE does not wish to have an attorney.
  Court addressed the DE.  Court addressed Ms. Garrett.
COURT:  60 days conditional jail time is granted with huber

Defendant Ryan A. Potack in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Requested prelim  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's demand.

1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.

Defendant Ryan A. Potack in court with Attorney Martin Jarvis (today).  John Martin Yackel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Acknowledges receipt of complaint; waives reading of complaint; advised of rights/penalties; advised of right to prelim; waives time limits for prelim - reserves right; Court enters NGP on ct 5. State requests bond be increased to $10,000 sig. bond; Def. does not object; Court modified bond.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2014 at 11:00 am.
DEF in court by video ADA in court reset

1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
EXCEPT that defendant may be on the premises of: 
for the purpose of employment, but only for the purpose of employment and only during his/her hours of employment.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
